questions.question: Which of the following carbonate salts is water-soluble?
When a carbonate salt reacts with dilute acid, which gas is evolved that turns lime water milky?
What is the color of most carbonate salts?
Which of the following observations is made when AgNO3 solution is added to a solution containing carbonate ions (CO3^2-)?
options: Formation of a pale yellow precipitate that dissolves in excess NH3
Formation of a white precipitate (Ag2CO3) that decomposes on boiling to give a brown precipitate

questions.question: All bicarbonates are water-soluble except:
Which gas is evolved when a bicarbonate salt reacts with dilute acid?
When CuCl2 solution is added to a bicarbonate solution and heated, what is the color of the precipitate formed?
All sulphides are water-insoluble except those of Group 1 and:
Most insoluble sulphides are what color?
Which gas with a rotten egg smell is evolved when a sulphide salt reacts with dilute acid?
When a filter paper dipped in lead acetate solution is brought near the mouth of a test tube containing a sulphide reacting with dilute acid, what is the color of the paper?
When AgNO3 solution is added to a solution containing sulphite ions (SO3^2-), what is the initial observation?
options: Formation of a white precipitate soluble in dilute HNO3
Formation of a white precipitate (Ag2SO3) that turns to black (Ag) on boiling

questions.question: Sulphite ions (SO3^2-) can act as:

Which of the following observations is made when CuCl2(aq) is added to a solution containing sulphite ions (SO3^2-)?
Hypo solution is chemically known as:
What is observed when dilute HCl is added to a thiosulphate solution?
options: Evolution of a colorless, odorless gas
Formation of a white precipitate only
Evolution of SO2 gas (smelling of burning sulfur) and formation of a yellow turbidity of sulfur

questions.question: Which reagent gives a blood-red color with thiosulphate ions in the presence of FeCl3 after initial treatment with KCN?
All nitrites are water-soluble except:
What is observed when dilute acid is added to a nitrite salt?
options: Evolution of nitrogen dioxide gas (NO2), which is reddish-brown
